title: Understanding the Gaussian Distribution
text: A Gaussian distribution, also known as a normal distribution, is a symmetric, bell-shaped curve. The mean is a key parameter of this distribution.

title: Identifying the Mean
text: In a Gaussian distribution, the mean is the point where the distribution is centered. It is also the point of symmetry for the curve.

hintAnswer: It is the peak of the distribution curve.
title: Locating the Mean on the Curve
text: Where is the mean located on a Gaussian distribution curve?
choices: It is the lowest point of the distribution curve.
It is the peak of the distribution curve.
It is the area under the curve.
It is the width of the curve.

title: Visualizing the Mean
text: Imagine the Gaussian curve as a hill. The mean is the highest point of this hill, where it is perfectly balanced on both sides.
